author: , The Daily Advertiser
title: Watch as thousands gather at massive iftar table to break Ramadan fast
text: Video shows thousands gathering for mass iftar in Cairo's Matareya neighborhood [Sarah Al-Arshani](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/8418677001/sarah-alarshani/) The streets of Cairo's Matareya neighborhood were lined with hundreds of tables as thousands gathered to break their fast together on the 15th of Ramadan. The annual community meal has been growing ever since it began in 2012 and has been dubbed the longest iftar table in Egypt. The event has taken place every except for two years during the COVID-19 pandemic, [CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/egypt-cairo-biggest-iftar-ramadan-muslim-holy-month-in-matareya/?linkId=375865201&fbclid=IwAR30GuXfRu5gY58vG09SshxjEi-f8WqFjV0DMQe5rLliUqkrP1hh___GO9k_aem_AUIl_uI0m2Fa7d3yOvvul3lomGpKLS6JGHZtFmyh3G9V1ohArSC_wjk6LHqnroASeqR-a8yie8LuWMv_Tgdu1rN-) reported. There is no official count of how many people took part in the Matareya iftar, but organizers said as many as 30,000 people attended, [Egypt Today](https://www.egypttoday.com/Article/1/131260/Matariyah-iftar-banquet-manifests-ingenuity-of-Egyptian-people-PM-Madbouli) reported. This year's event featured around 700 tables that stretched for more than half a mile across seven alleyways, [Gulf News](https://gulfnews.com/world/mena/egypt-10000-feast-at-cairos-matariya-mega-iftar-on-10th-anniversary-1.101903343) reported. Footage of the event showed packed streets lit with brightly colored Ramadan decorations lining the alleyways of the neighborhood in the eastern part of Cairo. When is Ramadan 2024?: [What is it? Muslims set to mark a month of spirituality, reflection](/story/news/nation/2024/03/08/ramadan-2024-when-what/72866014007/) Began with just a few neighbors At its start, the event was just a handful of neighbors breaking their fast together. Hamada Hassan told CBS News that no one had enough space in their home to host everyone, so they set up tables outside. It only continued to grow from there. Gulf News reported organizers begin preparing for the event around two months in advance every year. Preparations include everything from gathering necessary supplies to feed a whole neighborhood, to cleaning and decorating the streets, CBS News reported. Ahmed Ekram, an organizer said this year 10,000 meals were served, Gulf News reported, citing local media. Some in attendance didn't eat, but went to simply enjoy the camaraderie, CBS News reported. Local donations fund the costs of the event, which over the years has seen politicians, celebrities, and diplomats in attendance. “We do not care about the cost, as all the residents of the neighborhood participate in financing the table in order to bring joy and happiness to the people of the region and other neighboring areas," Ahmed Khalaf, one of the organizers of the 2023 event told [Arab News](https://www.arabnews.com/node/2284791/middle-east) at the time.

author: N.P.
title: Ramona Rinaldi trovata impiccata in casa, arrestato il compagno Daniele Re: "Ha simulato il suicidio"
text:
/ Como
Ramona Rinaldi trovata impiccata nella doccia, arrestato il compagno: "Ha simulato il suicidio"
Daniele Re avrebbe ucciso la madre di sua figlia per paura di essere lasciato. Gli indizi che lo hanno tradito
A febbraio Ramona Rinaldi, mamma di 39 anni originaria della provincia di Como, è stata trovata morta nel bagno della sua casa. Era impiccata nella doccia. Adesso, a distanza di mesi, la tesi del gesto volontario crolla e il compagno Daniele Re, 34 anni, finisce in carcere. L'uomo è accusato di avere ucciso la madre di sua figlia e poi avere simulato il suicidio. Vediamo come si è arrivati alla svolta.
Ramona Rinaldi trovata impiccata nella doccia: arrestato il compagno Daniele Re
Ramona e Daniele convivevano a Veniano, nel Comasco. Nella notte a cavallo tra il 20 e il 21 febbraio scorsi lei muore. All'alba del 21 febbraio, Daniele chiama i soccorsi sostenendo di essersi svegliato attorno alle 5 del mattino e di non avere trovato la compagna, salvo poi scoprirne il cadavere nella doccia di casa. Il gesto volontario, inizialmente ipotizzato, non ha mai convinto del tutto gli inquirenti e a distanza di mesi c'è stata la svolta.
Daniele Re è stato fermato a Milano. Risponde di omicidio volontario aggravato e maltrattamenti. Secondo la procura, Ramona non si sarebbe tolta la vita, ma sarebbe stata strangolata. Solo dopo Re avrebbe inscenato il suicidio.
Le indagini sono state condotte dai carabinieri, che hanno messo in luce le "stranezze" della storia e le incongruenze nel racconto dell'indagato. Non si capiva per esempio chi e perché avesse azionato la lavatrice che era proprio in bagno e che conteneva, tra gli altri indumenti, anche la camicia da notte di Ramona. Il sospetto è stato da subito che qualcuno avesse voluto liberarsi di un indizio. Non solo: i vicini di casa avevano detto di avere udito un forte tonfo nel cuore della notte. L'autopsia poi ha fatto emergere delle discrepanze tra il racconto di Re e l'effettivo orario del decesso. Non ultimo, chi conosceva Ramona ha sempre detto che mai la donna avrebbe lasciato la figlia neppure in un momento di massimo sconforto. Quanto al movente forse la paura dell'uomo di essere lasciato.

author: VNExplorer
title: Se COMPLICAN los FICHAJES SOÑADOS del Club América previo al Clausura 2024
text:
Gerardo Arteaga y Ricardo Chávez
El Club América está teniendo complicaciones con el mercado de fichajes invernal pues al parecer el lateral derecho que sonaba para llegar en la siguiente temporada, ni siquiera ha tenido algún tipo de acercamiento con el equipo azulcrema. El futbolista Ricardo Chávez, según información de Carlos Ponce De León, no llegará al Club América pues no existe ningún tipo de comunicación entre ambas partes.
Noticias Relacionadas
La VERDAD sobre el supuesto FICHAJE de Carlos Vela con el Club América
La VERDAD sobre el supuesto FICHAJE de Carlos Vela con el Club América
ЎOstia tГ­o! Club AmГ©rica podrГ­a tener NUEVO REFUERZO ESPAГ‘OL para el Clausura 2024
¡Ostia tío! Club América podría tener NUEVO REFUERZO ESPAÑOL para el Clausura 2024
Genk de Bélgica le pone PRECIO INFLADÍSIMO a Gerardo Arteaga para fichar con Club América
Genk de Bélgica le pone PRECIO INFLADÍSIMO a Gerardo Arteaga para fichar con Club América
Ricardo Chávez es el posible refuerzo de las Águilas del América, que sonaba para la siguiente temporada, los rumores se intensificaron en los últimos días porque el equipo al mando del director técnico André Jardine, quiere incorporar al plantel a un nuevo lateral por derecha tras la baja de Miguel Layún por su retiro del futbol profesional.
A pesar de que Kevin Álvarez también juega en esa posición, el combinado quiere tener un cambio para Álvarez, que sea un compañero que genere competencia interna que pueda mejorar el nivel dentro del plantel para la próxima temporada.
El futbolista de 29 años originario de Ciudad Victoria es un viejo conocido del estratega André Jardine, pues estuvieron en el mismo equipo cuando el carioca estaba al mando del combinado. Ricardo Chávez supo ganarse la titularidad con Jardine y con Gustavo Leal (DT Club Atlético de San Luis). Además, fue uno de los elementos más importantes del conjunto potosino en el Apertura 2023 con el que llegó hasta la semifinal, pero fueron eliminados por el Club América.
¿Cuáles son los números de Ricardo Chávez en el Apertura 2023? El mexicano registró un total de 16 enfrentamientos en la temporada regular con una anotación y asistencia. También fue uno de los jugadores determinantes en la Liguilla del futbol mexicano al enfrentar al Club León en Play IN, Rayados en los cuartos de final y las Águilas del América en semifinales.
¿Gerardo Arteaga llegará al Club América? Otro de los fichajes en los que la institución azulcrema está interesada es Gerardo Arteaga , quien desde hace algunas semanas está en el radar del equipo. Sin embargo, el mexicano de 25 años es pretendido por otros conjuntos europeos por lo que América no ha podido concretar el fichaje. Gerardo Arteaga juega para el KRC Genk en Bélgica y se tiene conocimiento de que al futbolista le interesaría regresar a la Liga MX por motivos personales. Además, se rumoraba que las Chivas Rayadas de Guadalajara estaban interesadas en contratar al jugador. Nada de los anteriores fichajes se ha confirmado oficialmente por parte del Club América o de los mismos jugadores; sin embargo, se informará acerca de esta situación en los próximos días para saber el paradero de ambos. El Club América tendrá un 2024 lleno de actividad pues además de la Liga MX jugarán la Liga de Campeones de Concacaf en el mes de febrero. Los de Coapa quieren conseguir el bicampeonato y su título número quince en la historia del futbol mexicano por lo que tendrán que reforzar sus zonas débiles y las posiciones que estén disponibles por las bajas.

author: Audrey Boucher
title: Fire department warns of smoke detector risks after Chippewa County family loses home
text:
CHIPPEWA COUNTY, Mich,. (WPBN/WGTU) - - Sault Ste. Marie Fire Department is urging you to check your smoke detectors after a family lost their home due to a fire.
Photographed above is what remains of a Sault Ste. Marie house that caught fire Wednesday morning.
Fire crews say when they arrived the house was fully engulfed with all six residents getting out safely.
However, the fire department said the home did not have functioning smoke detectors.
"They had taken them down because they were in the process of painting and doing some remodeling and that's common. A lot of people do that, and they don't think about that because most people the only time they hear a smoke alarm going off is they either burned their toast or dinner and they don't actually see the benefits they provide people in a fire situation. So unfortunately they didn't have them up,” said Chief Edwin Miller Sault Ste Marie Fire Department.
Chief Miller says smoke detectors need to be replaced every 10 years.
If anyone is in need of smoke detectors or needs theirs checked, contact their local fire department.

author: Clayton Edwards
title: Miranda Lambert Braves Freezing Temps to Feed Horses in New Video: “Cowgirls Don’t Cry…But I Want To”
text:
Tennessee residents found themselves under a thick blanket of snow after a winter storm hammered the region on Sunday (January 14) and Monday. Many businesses and other places of employment are closed. As a result, most Tennesseans are doing their best to stay inside and stay warm. However, people like
Miranda Lambert who have animals to care for don’t get a snow day.
Videos by American Songwriter
Lambert was born and raised in Texas. However, since becoming one of the biggest stars in country music, she relocated to the Nashville area. She currently resides on a 400-acre horse farm near Music City. Even with snow piling up and flakes still falling, the “Bluebird” singer had to brave the cold to care for the horses.
[[Miranda Lambert Las Vegas Residency: Get Tickets]]https://stubhub.prf.hn/click/camref:1101ljfZw/pubref:Miranda%20Lambert%20Braves%20Freezing%20Temps%20to%20Feed%20Horses%20in%20New%20Video%3A%20%22Cowgirls%20Don%27t%20Cry...But%20I%20Want%20To%22%20/destination:https%3A%2F%2Fwww.stubhub.com%2Fmiranda-lambert-tickets%2Fperformer%2F137562
She shared her adventures in wintery horse husbandry in a Tiktok video. In the post’s caption, she wrote, “This Southern gal isn’t made for the cold.”
The clip shows a bundled-up Lambert picking up an armful of hay. “Cowgirls don’t cry,” she proclaimed. “Not today. But I want to,” she added.
Then, the video shows the inside of her horse barn as she gives an update on the weather. “It is 11 degrees. It says it feels like zero,” she explained. Then, she told her horses, “We’re gonna have a stall hang day and eat a lot of hay.”
Miranda Lambert Looks to Heat Things Up with New Music
Last week, Lambert announced that she’s working on new music. She sat down with her fellow Pistol Annie and singer/songwriter Stephen Wilson Jr. to write a few songs. “Wrote the first songs of 2024 today with bestie Ashley Monroe and new friend Stephen Wilson Jr,” she wrote under a photo of the trio of artists. “I’ve been inspired by Ash and her melodies and heart for 20 years now. And Stephen’s record has lit a fire under my a-s since I laid ears on it,” she added. “We got deep in the paint.”
[[RELATED: Miranda Lambert Teases New Music With Ashley Monroe & Rising Country Artist Stephen Wilson Jr.]]https://americansongwriter.com/miranda-lambert-teases-new-music-ashley-monroe-rising-country-artist-stephen-wilson-jr/
Lambert didn’t share any details about the songs they wrote nor did she mention a new album. However, her last album, Palomino came out in 2022 and she’s writing new songs. So, it stands to reason that she’s working on a new project.
Featured Image by Emma McIntyre/Getty Images
